search_information.query_displayed: A Theory of Evaluation Applied to a University Faculty Hind, Robert R. And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: A theory of evaluation applied to a university faculty
organic_results.snippet: A theory of evaluation and authority is applied to the system for evaluating a university faculty. Evaluations by professional colleagues, compared to administrators, have greater influence upon the distribution of organizational sanctions. Evaluations of research are more influential, yet faculty devote more time to teaching. Faculty seek better balance between the evaluation system and their expenditure of effort. The visibility of research to outsiders makes organizational boundaries permeable and increases emphasis on research by …

publication_info.summary: RR Hind, SM Dornbusch, WR Scott - Sociology of Education, 1974 - JSTOR
